lines: $documentBuilder->addDocumentNote('Lieferant GmbH' . PHP_EOL . 'Lieferantenstraße 20' . PHP_EOL . '80333 München' . PHP_EOL . 'Deutschland' . PHP_EOL . 'Geschäftsführer: Hans Muster' . PHP_EOL . 'Handelsregisternummer: H A 123' . PHP_EOL . PHP_EOL, null, 'REG');
echo $validationResult === 0 ? 'Validation is disabled' : ($validationResult == 1 ? 'The document is valid' : 'The document is not valid');
First we create a new @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT in EN16931-Profile (== COMFORT-Profile)
First we create a new @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT in XRECHNUNG-Profile (Version 3.x)
Not mandatory, but welcome are details such as managing director, commercial register entry or similar
Indication of when the period covered by the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT begins and when it ends. Also referred to as the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DELIVERY period
Type code 916 is used without exception for @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT justifying documents
First example: Specification of an external resource including the intended primary access method, e.g. http:// or ftp://
Second example: Specification of a local file to be included in the document as a BASE64-encoded attachment
Add details to the tender or lot reference. In some countries, a reference to the tender that led to the contract must be provided.
Type code 50 is used exclusively for the specification of the tender or lot reference
Add details of the calculated object. Only the type code 130 is used to transmit an object identifier. Depending on the application,
an object identifier can be a subscription number, a telephone number, a meter reading, a vehicle, a person, etc.
Note: Additional documents of type code 130 may only be specified once.
Adding details to the associated contract
The contract reference should be assigned once in the context of the specific trading relationship and for a defined period of time.
Adding a detail to a project reference
Enter the identifier of the project to which the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT refers and the name of the project.
We should also define how payments are handled. In our case we want to use
a SEPA direct debit. We book from the IBAN DE12500105170648489890. We also provide a Creditor-Reference
We also need a creditor reference as the second parameter which is required for direct debit
An indispensable part of an @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT is the indication of the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_SELLER. Let's do that now.
The @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_BUYER details are also an important part of the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT.
You can specify a different payee. It is possible to enter a postal address and
a contact, but some validators issue a warning.
Sometimes it happens that you want to refer to an order (order number) transmitted by the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_BUYER when
issuing the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT. We enter the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_BUYER order number here:
Sometimes the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_SELLER wants to provide his @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_BUYER a reference to the internal sales order number
It is also possible to specify a different @TXTPART:TXTPART_DELIVERY point in the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT
It is possible to specify a contact at the different @TXTPART:TXTPART_DELIVERY point, but some validators issue a warning
A @TXTPART:TXTPART_DELIVERY date can also be specified within the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT
It is now time to add our first @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_LINE. This is defined as follows

- The @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRODUCTNAME is "Trennblätter A4" and has a @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_SELLER assigned @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_POSITION_ITEMNO "TB100A4" (setDocumentPositionProductDetails)

- The @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRODUCTNAME is "Joghurt Banane" and has a @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_SELLER assigned @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_POSITION_ITEMNO "ARNR2" (setDocumentPositionProductDetails)
Last but not least, we add a third and final @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_LINE. This should essentially also serve to clarify the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT calculation in the following

- The @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_POSITION_PRODUCTNAME is "Joghurt Erdbeer" and has a @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_SELLER assigned @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_POSITION_ITEMNO "ARNR3" (setDocumentPositionProductDetails)
Now we need to generate the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT_BREAKDOWN. This is an essential part of the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT.

You have to group the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT_BASE_AMOUNT:1 by @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT-Category ("S"), @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT-Type ("VAT") and @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT-Percent (19%, 7%)
- The first @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT summation comes at least from @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_LINE 1 - 19% @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT from 198.00 EUR (Net-Amount) = 37.62

- The second @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT summation comes at least from @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_LINE 2 & 3 - 7% @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT from 275.00 EUR + 400.00 EUR = 675.00 EUR (Net-Amount) = 47.25
Finally, there is an equally important part of the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT - the totals.
1. Grand total @TXTPART:TXTPART_AMOUNT = 198.00 EUR + 37.62 EUR (@TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT) + 675.00 EUR + 47.25 EUR (@TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT) = 957.87
2. @TXTPART:TXTPART_AMOUNT:2 to pay = We assume that there was no pre-payment and set the @TXTPART:TXTPART_AMOUNT to be paid equal to the grand total @TXTPART:TXTPART_AMOUNT
4. @TXTPART:TXTPART_SURCHARGE:2 total @TXTPART:TXTPART_AMOUNT = 0.00 EUR since we don't have any @TXTPART:TXTPART_SURCHARGE:1 in the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT
5. @TXTPART:TXTPART_ALLOWANCE:2 total @TXTPART:TXTPART_AMOUNT = 0.00 EUR since we don't have any @TXTPART:TXTPART_ALLOWANCE:1 in the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT
6. @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT basis total @TXTPART:TXTPART_AMOUNT = As a rule, this @TXTPART:TXTPART_AMOUNT corresponds to 3.
7. @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT_VAT total @TXTPART:TXTPART_AMOUNT = 19 % from 198.00 EUR = 37.62 EUR + 7% from 675.00 EUR = 47.28 EUR is 84.87 EUR
We can now generate the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT as a file...
... or have the generated XML returned as a string
We should also define the payment terms as a textual information
The first parameter defines the textual description of our payment terms.
The second parameter defines the due date of the @TXTPART:TXTPART_DOCUMENT. As you have chosen a direct debit procedure, this is the date of the direct debit.
The third parameter defines the mandant reference which is required for direct debit
In the XRECHNUNG it is required to provide a routing ID ("Leitweg ID")
Optionally validate XML. For details see 00_ExampleHelpers.php
